qas.question: What philosophy is closely related to process philosophy?
What pragmatists did Whitehead acknowledge in the preface to "Process and Reality"?
What founder of pragmatism's collected papers did Charles Hartshorne ans Paul Weiss edit?
What important neopragmatist was Harthorne's student?
Who is a philosopher that promotes process philosophy and pragmatism currently?
What pragmatists did Whitehead not acknowledge in the preface to "Process and Reality"?
What founder of pragmatism's collected papers did Charles Hartshorne and Paul Weiss not edit?
What unimportant neopragmatist was Harthorne's student?
Who is a philosopher that doesn't promote process philosophy and pragmatism currently?

context: One philosophical school which has historically had a close relationship with process philosophy is <a0_0>American pragmatism<a0_0/>. Whitehead himself thought highly of <a1_0><b5_0>William James and John Dewey<b5_0/><a1_0/>, and acknowledged his indebtedness to them in the preface to Process and Reality. Charles Hartshorne (along with Paul Weiss) edited the collected papers of <a2_0><b6_0>Charles Sanders Peirce<b6_0/><a2_0/>, one of the founders of pragmatism. Noted neopragmatist <a3_0><b7_0>Richard Rorty<b7_0/><a3_0/> was in turn a student of Hartshorne. Today, <a4_0><b8_0>Nicholas Rescher<b8_0/><a4_0/> is one example of a philosopher who advocates both process philosophy and pragmatism.
